posts.post_content:
It would seem that I've exhausted the trade market on these, so I'm putting prices on them [though I'm still open to trades if anyone is interested].  I've given them individual and discounted group prices; I've kept prices low, so they're firm.
If you want to claim an individual card, post below; first-posted gets it at the end of the day [if no one has bought the entire lot/Group].
If you want to buy the Group, first-posted also gets it, and the Group sale would take priority over an individual sale that day only.

All three groups, 25 cards in all, $525.

Group 1, Graded: All 5, $140, delivered.

WILLIS [portrait], SGC 1 [solid card for its grade], $45, delivered
Lennox, SGC 30, $28, delivered,
Maloney, SGC 30, $28, delivered,
Phelan, SGC 30, $28, delivered,
Solly Hoffman, SGC 30 [not pictured; scan coming], $28, delivered.

Take off $2 combined shipping for each additional card.

Group 2, Ungraded Cards: $350 for all 15.

Individual cards: Add $1 for S/H.  Three or more cards ship for free.
 
Clarke, Columbus [name is faint with bottom cut off, but recognizable], $18,
Camnitz, arms folded [short, likely trimmed, otherwise nice-looking card], $16White, Buffalo [nice front, no apparent creases, paper loss on back,], $18,
Malarkey, $14,
Donohue, $17,
HUGGINS, portrait [paper-loss on most of back], $25,
WALLACE [Measures up but off-center/miscut, with glue stains on back], $38,
FLICK, beautiful card, appears Ex, measures up but is trimmed, $55,
WILLIS, batting [nice appearance but trimmed; tiny spot on finger], $33,
WILLIS, pitching [heavily creased but presentable], $33,
Covaleski, $16, 
Bliss [speck of paper loss on bill of cap, over eye, otherwise pretty nice] $14,
CHANCE, orange portrait, $48,
Lattimore, $15,
Kleinow, batting, $13,

Note: These cards are in 2 protective plastics, a halved penny-sleeve--which creates the appearance of a line on the outer border--and a pocket-page:

Group 3: 5 Beaters, $50, delivered. 
Individually, $10 each + $1 S/H.

McBride [new addition, not depicted, scan upon request],
Fiene,
Stanage,
Lennox,
Happy Smith [moving, lost a chip more paper than depicted on right border].
 
If you're interested in trading, I prefer ungraded cards.  
 
No pm's, please.  Post here or Email [url]djdoremus@msn.com[/url].
  
Thanks.

Doug

Doug,

I got your email, and replied but it wouldn't allow me to send as your mailbox is full I too collect low grade t206 hofers! I will send you a list of what I have this evenin, but if you don't find something of interest, please consider it sold at 30. Best regards 

David

doug, 

the bender & collins t206's are packed and ready to be shipped tommorow am in exchange for the t202 walter johnson panel... I will provide you with the usps tracking # once in hand... If you could do the same it would be greatly appreciated...

Thanks for the trade,
David

Thanks, John, Brian, Todd, Ray, David, and Mike, for all the trades and sales.
I enjoyed the trades the most; as one of you said, it felt like like being a general manager.

Take a look at my new additions, above, and maybe we can deal some more.

Doug

It's been fun, full of good deals, and this thread's had a great run.

Doug
